column4: I run on an Intel Celeron. Should Is it advisable to install linux-image-686 and remove linux-image-386 ?
you mean I should use linux-image-686 ?
might be slightly faster, supports more RAM
of course, no one but opera is allowed to distribute it
microsoft excel is also not in ubunt
In hoary it was somewhere in the repos...
there has not been anything uploaded to dapper

From the old 2.4 days I had pnp os set to 'no' . Recentlry I moved a pci2usb2.0 card from pci slot 1 to slot pci 4 in order to make more room for my agp card and I found out that bios could not give her an IRQ. I turned pnp os to yes and now the card (and everything else) works... I read that 2.6 kernel is plugnplay OS.... Is it better to try to give the pci2usb card manualy an irq through bios and turn pnpos to no (or move the card to an
I was under the impression that "plug'n'play OS" only affected things like OS/2 and windows95
so leaving plugnplay os to 'yes' is ok... Right?
